expert_analysis.tactical_preview: Arteta looks settled in the hot seat and has the experience and maturity to go all the way this time. He shaped the squad to his liking this summer and wasn't afraid to double down on defensive reinforcements and quality backups.
key_storylines: Guardiola was lost for words when they lost 5-1 to Arsenal last season
Arsenal are cruising in the league and the Champions League without key cogs like Bukayo Saka and William Saliba
Viktor Gyokeres, Martin Zubimendi and Ebrechi Eze all made good starts to life in North London

arsenal.lineup: Raya; Timber, Saliba, Gabriel, Calafiori; Rice, Zubimendi, Nwaneri; Madueke, Gyokeres, Eze
arsenal.tactical_notes: Arsenal expected to attack from the start with Nwaneri potentially starting if Odegaard's shoulder injury persists

manchester_city.lineup: Donnarumma; Khusanov, Dias, Gvardiol, O'Reilly; Rodri; Silva, Reijnders, Foden, Doku; Haaland
manchester_city.tactical_notes: Guardiola confident of turning things around after Manchester Derby performance

arsenal_vs_manchester_city.expert_prediction: Arsenal's squad depth and form might edge the Citizens. The clash might be tough to call as things stand.
arsenal_vs_manchester_city.historical_context: Arsenal have won 100 out of the 213 matches played between the two teams, as opposed to City's record

expert_analysis.tactical_preview: Moyes' most commonly used formation at Anfield has been 4-2-3-1 – which is the same tactical set-up which has been implemented so effectively
key_storylines: Head-to-head numbers favour Liverpool, with 95 wins to Everton's 63 and 75 draws
The last meeting ended 1-0 to Liverpool thanks to a Diogo Jota goal
A low-scoring battle looks likely when Liverpool and Everton lock horns

liverpool.lineup: Alisson; Frimpong, Konaté, Van Dijk, Kerkez; Gravenberch, Mac Allister; Salah, Wirtz, Gakpo; Núñez
liverpool.tactical_notes: Liverpool have been grinding out narrow wins with their last two Premier League matches

everton.lineup: Pickford; Coleman, Tarkowski, Branthwaite, Mykolenko; Gueye, Onana; Harrison, Doucoure, McNeil; Calvert-Lewin
everton.tactical_notes: Moyes implementing defensive solidity with quick counter-attacks

liverpool_vs_everton.expert_prediction: Liverpool favored but Everton capable of causing upset in derby atmosphere

sources: Goal.com - Arsenal vs Manchester City Preview
BBC Sport - Liverpool vs Everton Key Stats

expert_analysis.tactical_preview: Chelsea have experienced a tactical metamorphosis under new manager Enzo Maresca, lining up in a base 4-2-3-1. Brighton are arguably the most tactically flexible side in the Premier League
key_storylines: Brighton's tactical flexibility makes them difficult to pin down
Chelsea's new 4-2-3-1 formation under Maresca showing promise
Both teams capable of high-scoring encounters

chelsea.lineup: Sánchez; James, Fofana, Colwill, Cucurella; Caicedo, Fernández; Madueke, Palmer, Sterling; Jackson
chelsea.tactical_notes: Maresca's tactical metamorphosis with clear 4-2-3-1 structure

brighton.lineup: Verbruggen; Veltman, Dunk, van Hecke, Estupiñan; Groß, Gilmour; Mitoma, Lallana, March; Welbeck
brighton.tactical_notes: Most tactically flexible side in Premier League, difficult to predict exact setup

chelsea_vs_brighton.expert_prediction: High-scoring affair expected with both teams' attacking capabilities

expert_analysis.tactical_preview: Tottenham join Liverpool as strong starters this season with three victories from four under Thomas Frank. Manchester United looking to bounce back
key_storylines: Tottenham's strong start to the season with 3 wins from 4
Manchester United seeking consistency under new management
Both teams with attacking intent and pace

manchester_united.tactical_notes: Focus on quick transitions and utilizing pace in wide areas
